Name: Event Code
Notes: Code identifying the event about which a report is made

Name: Time
Notes: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

Name: State or Province Code
Notes: Code (Standard State/Province) as defined by appropriate government agency

Name: Standard Point Location Code
Notes: Code (Standard Point Location) defined by NMFTA point development group as the official code assigned to a city or point (for ratemaking purposes) within a city
Remarks: V909 is the Standard Point Location Code (SPLC) of the event shown in the V901.

Name: Quantity
Remarks:
P1011: If either V9-10 or V9-11 is present, then the other is required
V910 is the length of the time delay expressed in hours.

Name: Train Delay Reason Code
Notes: Code specifying reason for train delay

Name: Time Code
Notes: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow
Remarks:
C1304: If V9-13 is present, then V9-04 is required
V913 reflects the time zone which the event time reflects.

Name: Quantity
Remarks: V914 is the quantity of the fuel in gallons.

Name: Standard Point Location Code
Notes: Code (Standard Point Location) defined by NMFTA point development group as the official code assigned to a city or point (for ratemaking purposes) within a city
Remarks:
C1509: If V9-15 is present, then V9-09 is required
V915 is the Standard Point Location Code (SPLC) of the secondary point of the delay indicated in the V911.

Name: Total Equipment
Remarks: V916 is the total number of rail cars associated with the event code in V901.

Name: Total Equipment
Remarks: V917 is the total number of loaded cars associated with the event code in V901.

Name: Total Equipment
Remarks: V918 is the total number of empty cars associated with the event code in V901.

Name: Weight
Remarks: V919 is the total Gross Tons of the cars identified in V916. Includes the gross weight of the loads and the tare weight of the empties.

Name: Length
Notes: Largest horizontal dimension of an object measured when the object is in the upright position
Remarks: V920 is the total outside foot length of the cars identified in V916, rounded off to the nearest foot.
